commit_message:
bump ceilometermiddleware upper-constraint

master ceilometer grenade gate is broken because
ocata ceilometermiddleware lib is incompatible with master oslo.messaging.

the issue is that in grenade tests, requirements will get bumped to
master upper-constraints so in current case, oslo.messaging==5.18.0.
unfortunately, ceilometermiddleware is not in requirements of any
project and set up conditionally in devstack[1]. because of this, it
does not get bumped to master upper-constraints and is stuck at
ceilometermiddleware==1.0.0 which is incompatible with 5.18.0.

this patch bumps ocata upper-constaint to 1.0.1 as it was released
specifically to handle this incompatibility[2]. it is also compatible
with oslo.messaging api from ocata (and newton... and possible mitaka)

[1] https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/55dab95237302fa371b88a2edce06de201d83f52/lib/swift#L756-L763
[2] https://github.com/openstack/ceilometermiddleware/commit/d7c9cb361264f651d6fa6c7c6a44795d4aaa707a

Change-Id: Ifc40e00744ab221d3f27c3a27f0180e34549a75b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/13/442913/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ceilometermiddleware===1.0.1

subject: Remove keystone_auth_uri_v2
revisions:

commit_message:
Remove keystone_auth_uri_v2

Remove keystone_auth_uri_v2 and :

* Switch heat keystone_ec2_uri to use keystone_auth_uri (v3 endpoint).
* Switch aodh auth_url to use keystone_auth_uri
* Switch nova to use keystone_auth_uri for ironic.
* Switch ironic inspector to use keystone_auth_uri.

Partial-Implement: blueprint keystone-v3
Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id5b000876cdd0a9a9403825870324c558c1bc3cc
Depends-On: Icb2a058d08325fba4bdb934e265938741ed7d4ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/60/442860/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: aodh::auth::auth_url: "%{hiera('keystone_auth_uri')}"nova::ironic::common::auth_url: "%{hiera('keystone_identity_uri')}"ironic::inspector::ironic_auth_url: "%{hiera('keystone_auth_uri')}"ironic::inspector::swift_auth_url: "%{hiera('keystone_auth_uri')}"

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-01 01:55:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-api/commit/4c133bceef1f34db5b9452424406e514d6fbda8b', 'message': "add keystone middleware update logic

In order to support changes in the api-paste.ini file for the keystone
middleware of the neutron-api service by subordinates we need a generic
mechanism to pass wsgi middleware data via a relation.

The following approach is used in this change:

- relation data set by subordinates:
{'extra_middleware': [{
        'type': 'middleware_type',
        'name': 'middleware_name',
        'config': {
            'setting_1': 'value_1',
            'setting_2': 'value_2'}}]}
- there may be many subordinates each with their own set of middleware
all of which should be taken into account
- besides a factory method for middleware other settings can be
specified, therefore, a generic config dictionary is used
- neutron-server has to be restarted as api-paste.ini is read upon
startup of the service
- api-paste.ini rendering code is added along with a template code
containing loops over a list of middleware provided in a context to
construct the following entries:

keystone = [name-1 ... name-m] <default_middleware>

[type-1:name-1]
key-1 = value-1
...
key-n = value-n
...
[type-m:name-m]
key-1 = value-1
...
key-k = value-k

- api-paste.ini defaults are copied from their respective upstream
neutron branches

Change-Id: I9449aa2e85b1523f24acdcee11ca1f635dda47c0

commit_message:
add keystone middleware update logic

In order to support changes in the api-paste.ini file for the keystone
middleware of the neutron-api service by subordinates we need a generic
mechanism to pass wsgi middleware data via a relation.

The following approach is used in this change:

- relation data set by subordinates:
{'extra_middleware': [{
        'type': 'middleware_type',
        'name': 'middleware_name',
        'config': {
            'setting_1': 'value_1',
            'setting_2': 'value_2'}}]}
- there may be many subordinates each with their own set of middleware
all of which should be taken into account
- besides a factory method for middleware other settings can be
specified, therefore, a generic config dictionary is used
- neutron-server has to be restarted as api-paste.ini is read upon
startup of the service
- api-paste.ini rendering code is added along with a template code
containing loops over a list of middleware provided in a context to
construct the following entries:

keystone = [name-1 ... name-m] <default_middleware>

[type-1:name-1]
key-1 = value-1
...
key-n = value-n
...
[type-m:name-m]
key-1 = value-1
...
key-k = value-k

- api-paste.ini defaults are copied from their respective upstream
neutron branches

Change-Id: I9449aa2e85b1523f24acdcee11ca1f635dda47c0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-neutron-api refs/changes/70/439270/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: (nutils.API_PASTE_INI, { 'services': ['neutron-server'], }), '/etc/neutron/api-paste.ini',

subject: FQDN validation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-14 17:44:36.000000000', 'files': ['validation-scripts/all-nodes.sh', 'all-nodes-validation.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/bae2d113938b9bb22d4c291ae312d2299187f72b', 'message': 'FQDN validation

Adds optional validation to ensure FQDN set by Nova matches /etc/hosts
as created by overcloud heat configuration.

Consistent FQDN requires the nova parameter [Default]/dhcp_domain to
match the CloudDomain tht parameter.

This validation is disabled by default.

Change-Id: Ib5689acae66baf63ecccbc3b1c0b96684781b863
'}]
commit_message:
FQDN validation

Adds optional validation to ensure FQDN set by Nova matches /etc/hosts
as created by overcloud heat configuration.

Consistent FQDN requires the nova parameter [Default]/dhcp_domain to
match the CloudDomain tht parameter.

This validation is disabled by default.

Change-Id: Ib5689acae66baf63ecccbc3b1c0b96684781b863
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/20/433820/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ValidateFqdn: default: false description: Optional validation to ensure FQDN as set by Nova matches the name set in /etc/hosts. type: boolean - name: validate_fqdn default: {get_param: ValidateFqdn}

subject: Keystone token flush cron job should log to a file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 17:46:11.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/keystone.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/480e35a92b862e9e7bdb94336b202c503cb654b9', 'message': 'Keystone token flush cron job should log to a file

Keystone UUID tokens require the token_flush job to delete expired
tokens to prevent the disk from filling.  When the job runs, it should
be allowed to log to the disk so that the job can be traced if required.

Change-Id: I62e36e0968902564b97093a45df15e963ad08242
Closes-Bug: #1648174
'}]
commit_message:
Keystone token flush cron job should log to a file

Keystone UUID tokens require the token_flush job to delete expired
tokens to prevent the disk from filling.  When the job runs, it should
be allowed to log to the disk so that the job can be traced if required.

Change-Id: I62e36e0968902564b97093a45df15e963ad08242
Closes-Bug: #1648174
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/37/408237/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: keystone::cron::token_flush::destination: '/var/log/keystone/keystone-tokenflush.log'

subject: Use unicode match for name_or_id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-03 04:13:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/shade/commit/8b1b68957e10cb2535751664de9e156fc9cfe59e', 'message': "Use unicode match for name_or_id

The name_or_id field might be a unicode string.  Make sure we don't
run into problems comparing it by converting all comparison objects.

This is a follow-on to Id89bbf6306adebe96c1db417a4b8b5ae51023af0 based
on/as an alternative to I546b1fbd3375861173f411a7cfdb9e1baa5e6250

Change-Id: I4e7fa49bd8525148961f02b0e0d7b567145a68b6
Co-Authored-By: Liu Qing <liuqing@chinac.com>
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-03 05:19:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/shade/commit/1244dc2424559085f81910b87d74ebbf73ef7982', 'message': "Use unicode match for name_or_id

The name_or_id field might be a unicode string.  Make sure we don't
run into problems comparing it by converting all comparison objects.

This is a follow-on to Id89bbf6306adebe96c1db417a4b8b5ae51023af0 based

commit_message:
Use unicode match for name_or_id

The name_or_id field might be a unicode string.  Make sure we don't
run into problems comparing it by converting all comparison objects.

This is a follow-on to Id89bbf6306adebe96c1db417a4b8b5ae51023af0 based
on/as an alternative to I546b1fbd3375861173f411a7cfdb9e1baa5e6250

Closes-Bug: 1668849
Change-Id: I4e7fa49bd8525148961f02b0e0d7b567145a68b6
Co-Authored-By: Liu Qing <liuqing@chinac.com>

subject: Don't glob match name_or_id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-03 03:17:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/shade/commit/40d5d06d7b4c73057bbf5754bb948dc882c05dd1', 'message': 'Handle glob characters in name_or_id

I was trying to bring up a host on vexxhost using the image name
"Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS [2017-03-02]".  As described in the change,
because this gets run through fnmatch() directly it makes everything
barf as "[2017-03-02]" gets matched as an incorrect glob character
class.

This is a little tricky because all the external list_*, search_*,
get_* API functions basically pass name_or_id through directly.  None
of them have ever explicitly said that you could use globbing,
although it probably would have worked.  Any such use would have been
relying on implementation details of the _util functions, and I feel
like the fact it's _underscore_utils means that you probably had fair
warning not to do that.  And obviously the "filters" argument is meant
for this type of filtering.

Thus I think it is safe to escape the glob characters before
searching.

unit tests.

commit_message:
Don't glob match name_or_id

I was trying to bring up a host on vexxhost using the image name
"Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS [2017-03-02]".  As described in the change,
because this gets run through fnmatch() directly it makes everything
barf as "[2017-03-02]" gets matched as an incorrect glob character
class.

This is a little tricky because all the external list_*, search_*,
get_* API functions basically pass name_or_id through directly.  None
of them have ever explicitly said that you could use globbing,
although it probably would have worked.  Any such use would have been
relying on implementation details of the _util functions, and I feel
like the fact it's _underscore_utils means that you probably had fair
warning not to do that.  And obviously the "filters" argument is meant
for this type of filtering.

Additionally, fnmatch() says that it normalises case depending on OS
filename case-sensitivity, which seems like incorrect behaviour for
these functions which are not actually related to filenames.

Thus I believe the matching should be just be a straight string
comparison.

I have added a test for this, but we also have to remove the tests for
globbing behaviour as they are incorrect now.

Change-Id: Id89bbf6306adebe96c1db417a4b8b5ae51023af0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/shade refs/changes/14/440914/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _escape_name_or_id(name_or_id): """Escape special chars in name_or_id""" # this is a glob-escaping trick to wrap any of [?* in [] so it # looks like a character-class of just that single character # (e.g. [[]). # See also python3.4 glob.escape() r = re.compile('([[?*])') return r.sub(r'[\1]', name_or_id) The name or ID of the entity being filtered. Note glob patterns ([?*) are escaped. # Somebody might have named their image "foo [2017-01-10]" # which causes a problem when running this through fnmatch -- # is a "[" in a name literal "[" or the start of a # character-class glob match? Although this passes to # fnmatch(), which handles globs, the external interfaces # using this (search_*, list_* etc) never mentioned the # name_or_id was "globable" and thus needed to be escaped. # Thus we escape it here. name_or_id = _escape_name_or_id(str(name_or_id)) if ((e_id and fnmatch.fnmatch(str(e_id), name_or_id)) or str(e_name), name_or_id))):
deleted_lines: The name or ID of the entity being filtered. Can be a glob pattern, such as 'nb01*'. if ((e_id and fnmatch.fnmatch(str(e_id), str(name_or_id))) or str(e_name), str(name_or_id)))):

subject: devstack: Make sentry _IRONIC_DEVSTACK_LIB a global variable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-07 22:41:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/55093182e810ebdd259b59d4aa396bee33a910f1', 'message': "devstack: Make _IRONIC_DEVSTACK_LIB a global variable

When using 'declare' it is by default a local variable. But the other
variables in devstack/lib/ironic are not using declare so they become
globals and they are exposed when a function sources
devstack/lib/ironic to the caller of the function. But
_IRONIC_DEVSTACK_LIB was a local and not propagating like the other
variables.

Change-Id: I24b6ebb89f3d950d39b0665346b4c17bf05d0a0b
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-08 16:20:25.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/1e560b182f3d6380d6c2a10d01361f00b5f2b73f', 'message': "devstack: Make sentry _IRONIC_DEVSTACK_LIB a global variable

Make the sentry variable _IRONIC_DEVSTACK_LIB a global variable so
that it will work as expected.

When variables use the 'declare' directive, it is by default a local
variable. While other variables have global scope.

For example:
   declare -A AN_ARRAY   # local in scope
   foo=1                 # global in scope
   declare -A -g SPAM    # global in scope because of -g

This causes errors to occur as some of the variables will be local only
and others will be global.

The issue that can occur is that when sourcing devstack/lib/ironic a
second time the sentry _IRONIC_DEVSTACK_LIB will not be set but all
the other variables from devstack/lib/ironic will already have been
set as they are by default global variables. And the purpose of
_IRONIC_DEVSTACK_LIB is to prevent the file from being sourced twice.

Change-Id: I24b6ebb89f3d950d39b0665346b4c17bf05d0a0b
"}]
commit_message:
devstack: Make sentry _IRONIC_DEVSTACK_LIB a global variable

Make the sentry variable _IRONIC_DEVSTACK_LIB a global variable so
that it will work as expected.

When variables use the 'declare' directive, it is by default a local
variable. While other variables have global scope.

For example:
   declare -A AN_ARRAY   # local in scope
   foo=1                 # global in scope
   declare -A -g SPAM    # global in scope because of -g

This causes errors to occur as some of the variables will be local only
and others will be global.

The issue that can occur is that when sourcing devstack/lib/ironic a
second time the sentry _IRONIC_DEVSTACK_LIB will not be set but all
the other variables from devstack/lib/ironic will already have been
set as they are by default global variables. And the purpose of
_IRONIC_DEVSTACK_LIB is to prevent the file from being sourced twice.

Change-Id: I24b6ebb89f3d950d39b0665346b4c17bf05d0a0b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/45/442845/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: declare -r -g _IRONIC_DEVSTACK_LIB=1

commit_message:
[doc] Fix dev-ref about 'os-vol-image-meta'

In the dev-ref, the URI of 'os-vol-image-meta' command
is listed incorrectly. So we'd better fix it or it
will mislead users.

Incorrect URI:
  GET  /v2/{tenant_id}/os-vol-image-meta
Correct URI:
  POST  /v2/{tenant_id}/volumes/{volume_id}/action,
        with os-show_image_metadata action.

Change-Id: I00a7ca0f6df70dd7bcb1ada65113daccb0de8c25
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/23/341523/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: .. -*- rst -*- =================================================== Volume image metadata extension (os-vol-image-meta) =================================================== Shows image metadata that is associated with a volume. Show image metadata for volume ============================== .. rest_method:: GET /v2/{tenant_id}/os-vol-image-meta Shows image metadata for a volume. When the request is made, the caller must specify a reference to an existing storage volume in the ``ref`` element. Each storage driver may interpret the existing storage volume reference differently but should accept a reference structure containing either a ``source- volume-id`` or ``source-volume-name`` element, if possible. Error response codes:202, Request ------- .. rest_parameters:: parameters.yaml - description: description - availability_zone: availability_zone - bootable: bootable - volume_type: volume_type - name: name - volume: volume - host: host - ref: ref - metadata: metadata - tenant_id: tenant_id Request Example --------------- .. literalinclude:: ./samples/image-metadata-show-request.json :language: javascript

commit_message:
OVO request_spec in migrate/manage/retype calls

This commit updates migrate, manage and retype calls to use RequestSpec
object instead of passing an undefined dict blob. This is required to be
able to do changes in request_spec structure while maintaining backward
compatibilty (and rolling upgrades).

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects
Closes-Bug: 1529636

Change-Id: I72e736b77187ecf616e4ca1d14604d6d57228aa2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/58/252458/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FIXME(dulek): Once volume will be an object this should just call # volume.volume_type. volume_type = objects.VolumeType() qos_specs = None if volume_type_id: volume_type = objects.VolumeType.get_by_id(context.elevated(), # TODO(dulek): qos_specs are not part of Volume or VolumeType yet, # so we need to fetch them manually. Before this commit we haven't # taken them into account on migrate... qos_specs_db = volume_types.get_volume_type_qos_specs( volume_type_id) if qos_specs_db['qos_specs']: qos_specs = qos_specs_db['qos_specs'].get('specs', {}) if not qos_specs: # to make sure we don't pass empty dict qos_specs = None # FIXME(dulek): We should use from_volume method to do that once we # have volume object here. volume_properties = objects.VolumeProperties(**volume) volume_properties.qos_specs = qos_specs request_spec = objects.RequestSpec() request_spec.volume_properties = volume_properties request_spec.volume_type = volume_type request_spec.volume_id = volume['id'] request_spec = objects.RequestSpec() request_spec.volume_id = volume.id vol_type_obj = objects.VolumeType() objects.VolumeType._from_db_object(context, vol_type_obj, vol_type) request_spec.volume_type = vol_type_obj request_spec.migration_policy = migration_policy request_spec.quota_reservations = reservations request_spec.volume_properties = objects.VolumeProperties(**volume)
deleted_lines: volume_type = {} if volume_type_id: volume_type = volume_types.get_volume_type(context.elevated(), request_spec = {'volume_properties': volume, 'volume_type': volume_type, 'volume_id': volume['id']} request_spec = {'volume_properties': volume, 'volume_id': volume.id, 'volume_type': vol_type, 'migration_policy': migration_policy, 'quota_reservations': reservations}

commit_message:
Support volume migration between different availability zones

Currently volume migration bewteen different availability zones
does not work. Sometimes the users need to migrate volume from one
availability zone to another one. This patch will support it.

Change-Id: I9438f2ca61159e61b73616e58422d2d71ee42729
Implements: blueprint volume-migration-between-availability-zones

commit_message:
Implement trust support for cinder

In cinder task flow of creating volume from image, it may takes
long time to download image from glance if the image size is large,
which will cause token expiration and then any other wsgi request
will raise expection 'NotAuthorized'.
This blueprint intends to implement trust support for cinder by
refreshing token when expection 'NotAuthorized' raised, and help
the creating process running when image downloading consumes too
much time.

Change-Id: I3778a08665e16c637996a69c05eaad98c4ea1bb2
blueprint: image-trust-authentication
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/25/331925/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import encodeutilsfrom cinder.common import trust_authfrom cinder.i18n import _, _LE, _LI, _LWdef refresh_token_on_exception(exceptions): def _decorator(f): @six.wraps(f) def _wrapper(*args, **kwargs): refresher = None context = args[0] try: return f(*args, **kwargs) except exceptions as e: try: # request user pluging for current token user_plugin = context.get_auth_plugin() refresher = trust_auth.TokenRefresher(user_plugin, context.tenant, context.roles) except Exception as e: LOG.info(_LI("Unable to create trust: %s " "Use the existing user token."), encodeutils.exception_to_unicode(e)) if refresher is not None: context.auth_token = refresher.refresh_token() try: refresher.release_resources() except Exception as e: LOG.info(_LI("Unable to delete trust %(trust)s:" " %(msg)s"), {"trust": refresher.trust_id, "msg": encodeutils.exception_to_unicode(e)}) return f(*args, **kwargs) else: raise else: raise return _wrapper return _decorator @refresh_token_on_exception(exception.ImageNotAuthorized)

commit_message:
Policy: Add qos_specs_manage to policy.json

Declare volume_extension:qos_specs_manage as rule:admin_api to
communicate intended users of qos-specs API, as enforced by underlying
qos-specs implementation.

Change-Id: Id12b649c25a08b987943746daf20e29ab0957661
Partial-Bug: #1621715

commit_message:
LVM driver: improve performance of list manageable

With 100 volumes, listing manageable volumes took around 30 seconds
due to O(N) calls to lvdisplay. Changed to a single call, now takes
around 4 seconds for over 1600 volumes.

Change-Id: I8ee397c1c936a644e2fe48beda327a1a9ba03150

but are not used in other *.inc files.

commit_message:
Fix return values of consistencygroup actions in Pure storage driver.

- create_consistencygroup_from_src
- delete_consistencygroup
- create_cgsnapshot
- delete_cgsnapshot

Resource updates are taken care by VolumeManager and in the above listed actions,
resource_id and resource_status are updated more than once. Also,
inconsistencies could result in some cases, for example in
delete_consistencygroup method in VolumeManager class, we update DB with
volume_id and volume_status returned from the driver by calling
db.volume_update and before calling db.volume_destroy that later updates rest
of the fields(along with updating id and status again), another process could
be reading the DB. To avoid multiple DB updates and inconsistencies, the return
values of these methods in the driver could be set to None.

Change-Id: I326dfebe8cc549c21287c41289f8068f3a1ffb43

commit_message:
Remove self.__dict__ for formatting strings

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#dictionaries-lists.
It is not clear as using explicit dictionaries and help avoid some
errors during refactoring.

Change-Id: I21a38c8072cf8508baddd66ef1b965a488fb0e14

commit_message:
Cleanup unused model_update initialization

In VolumeManager class, model_update which is used to store returned
values from the drivers, doesn't need to be initialized to None.
Removing the initialization from all the methods in the class where
it is unused.

Change-Id: I3c058800b90e275455cbad7325aaa8fb5760aa88

This change is intend to implement this approved guideline[1].
To return the error message to users, we define an
error-code when an exception is raised in cinder-api layer.
And this error-code is added to the raised exception
as a metadata.
A new miroversion is added for different format of error
message. In class Fault, different format of error messages
are returned to user according to requested api version.

This provides an example of this spec[2] which is still in review.

[1]: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/errors.html
[2]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/293306/

commit_message:
[WIP]enhanche error message

This change is intend to implement this approved guideline[1].
To return the error message to users, we define an error-code
when an exception is raised in cinder-api layer. And this
error-code is added to the raised exception as a metadata.

A new miroversion is added for different format of error message.
In class Fault, different format of error messages are returned
to user according to requested api version. This provides an
example of this spec[2] which is still in review.

[1]: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/errors.html
[2]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/293306/
APIImpact

Depends-On: Icb0927a0460eb2888469cae0130602ce3b129bbf

commit_message:
add reset-state API for consistency groups

The state of cg will be error when volumes to join cg fails.
Add reset-state API to support reset the state of cgs to the right
state.

Change-Id: Ie91b9184c7d9138c6050ca552e7e3c5fa289d7bb
Implements: bp reset-consistencygroup-state
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/48/320748/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_reset_status_consistencygroup(self): consistencygroup_id = '1234' expected = {'os-reset_status': {'status': 'error'}} vol = cs.consistencygroups.reset_state( consistencygroup_id, 'error') cs.assert_called('POST', '/consistencygroups/1234/action', body=expected) self._assert_request_id(vol) expected = {'os-reset_status': {'status': 'available'}} vol = cs.consistencygroups.reset_state( consistencygroup_id, 'available') cs.assert_called('POST', '/consistencygroups/1234/action', body=expected) self._assert_request_id(vol)

commit_message:
Adds unit test coverage for manage_existing flow

The cinder.volume.flows.manager.manage_existing module has very low
unit test coverage. Add a unit test to increase this coverage.

Change-Id: I885f19204c2a16a244aff73dc46f606ccfce39a7
Closes-Bug: #1599140

commit_message:
Convert dicts objects to OVO

Dicts that were previously passed in by ID are now versioned
objects that are passed into functions directly. The old way of doing
things is still functional and OVO should work too.

commit_message:
Remove deprecated host option

This option has been deprecated since Juno in:
5fb266a0dac0c4c6538ee2661cb186a5c0fe6d6a

This removes the option and continues to allow the function of
overriding a host's value by using the backend_host option. In addition
you can now set the backend_host option in the [DEFAULT] section so it's
set for all backends.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ib286d01b9826a4c3064ee8bfab251c4c47407b51
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/54/380854/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CONF.set_override('backend_host', 'host') CONF.set_override('backend_host', 'host')

commit_message:
Add --is-public option to type-list

Now the server has already supported to filter
volume types based on the is-public property.
In CLI we should support it as well.

usage: cinder type-list [--is-public <True|False>]

By default, for admin user, the command will return
all public and non-public types, just as same as before,
if --is-public option is not specified.

Change-Id: Ibdb147ed9566f72e43ae57c17196e490a6e81f5e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/81/335881/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_volume_list(self): self.run_command('type-list') self.assert_called('GET', '/types?is_public=None') def test_volume_list_is_public(self): self.run_command('type-list --is-public=False') self.assert_called('GET', '/types?is_public=False') def test_volume_list_is_public_invalid_bool(self): self.assertRaises(ValueError, self.run_command, 'type-list --is-public=invalid_bool')

subject: Remove unneeded in_use flag checking for multipath
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-07 09:12:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/eef529be52eceae971dea3448048ad22a31b6ec4', 'message': 'remove unneeded in_use flag checking for multipath

In iSCSI connector, _disconnect_volume_multipath_iscsi() checks
if no other multipath device attached has the iqn and portal
as same as the detaching multipath device.
The checking code using in_use flag depends on persistent-named symbolic
links("/dev/disk/by-path/ip-*") for iSCSI devices which constitute
the detaching multipath device. However, the links are deleted in
advance of calling _disconnect_volume_multipath_iscsi().
So, the checking code wouldn't work properly and should be fixed
in proper way.

The proper way is to just check whether the discovered iSCSI targets
via sendtargets discovery associate with iSCSI block devices
("/dev/disk/by-path/ip-*") or not.
If the target doesn't associate with any iSCSI block device, the target
is never used by anyone and can be disconnected.

This patch removes the in_use flag checking in
_disconnect_volume_multipath_iscsi() and the related codes.
The other codes in _disconnect_volume_multipath_iscsi are valid.

Change-Id: Idbc3cb0b6170afd8d2e8339be2cf8bd05aa45453
Partial-Bug: 1487169

commit_message:
Remove unneeded in_use flag checking for multipath

In iSCSI connector, _disconnect_volume_multipath_iscsi() checks
if no other multipath device attached has the iqn and portal
as same as the detaching multipath device.
The checking code using in_use flag depends on persistent-named symbolic
links("/dev/disk/by-path/ip-*") for iSCSI devices which constitute
the detaching multipath device. However, the links are deleted in
advance of calling _disconnect_volume_multipath_iscsi().
So, the checking code wouldn't work properly and should be fixed
in proper way.

The proper way is to just check whether the discovered iSCSI targets
via sendtargets discovery associate with iSCSI block devices
("/dev/disk/by-path/ip-*") or not.
If the target doesn't associate with any iSCSI block device, the target
is never used by anyone and can be disconnected.

This patch removes the in_use flag checking in
_disconnect_volume_multipath_iscsi() and the related codes.
The other codes in _disconnect_volume_multipath_iscsi are valid.

Change-Id: Idbc3cb0b6170afd8d2e8339be2cf8bd05aa45453
Partial-Bug: 1487169

commit_message:
Don't create snapshots from error volumes

Cinder will try to create snapshots from volumes of any status
if we set True to the force parameter of "Create snapshot" API.
If a volume is error status and does not have a host, a snapshot
of "creating" status will be created.

This patch allows to create snapshots from volumes of the
following statuses if the force parameter is True.
 - available
 - in-use
 - attaching
 - detaching
 - backing-up

The patch allows to create snapshots from volumes of the
following statuses if the force parameter is False.
 - available
 - attaching
 - detaching
 - backing-up

Closes-Bug: #1507688

Change-Id: I207b85cdedab568fde99ecb20077ddcb4189c92f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/26/249826/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-26 16:39:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/808e4a9daa62cfd936ab24d0276e6e7e86a8547a', 'message': "Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added where applicable.

Note: This change is not newton critical so projects are welcome
to hold off on committing until post-newton. Ideally this change
will merge by the first part of Ocata so dependant functionality
can land and have time to solidify for Ocata.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Change-Id: Ia8d271ebce978191e1ca7bf940c83d22d7913810

commit_message:
Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be added/removed where applicable.

Note: This change is not newton critical so projects are welcome
to hold off on committing until post-newton. Ideally this change
will merge by the first part of Ocata so dependant functionality
can land and have time to solidify for Ocata.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Closes-Bug: #1635381

Change-Id: Ia8d271ebce978191e1ca7bf940c83d22d7913810
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/35/368235/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: import retrying def _retry_on_exception(e): return isinstance(e, exceptions) def _backoff_sleep(previous_attempt_number, delay_since_first_attempt_ms): wait_val = random.randrange(interval * 1000.0, wait_for * 1000.0) else: wait_val = wait_for * 1000.0 LOG.debug("Sleeping for %s seconds", (wait_val / 1000.0)) def _print_stop(previous_attempt_number, delay_since_first_attempt_ms): delay_since_first_attempt = delay_since_first_attempt_ms / 1000.0 LOG.debug("Failed attempt %s", previous_attempt_number) delay_since_first_attempt) return previous_attempt_number == retries r = retrying.Retrying(retry_on_exception=_retry_on_exception, wait_func=_backoff_sleep, stop_func=_print_stop)

commit_message:
Fix using filter() to meet python2,3

As mentioned in link[1], if we need filter on python3,
Replace filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data) with:
[obj for obj in data if test(obj)].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

Change-Id: I5c831aaa214aec584c715bce8a8cafa25e39caa1

commit_message:
Added error handling for python2/3 int conversion

Though Python 2 has a different definition of 'int'
than Python 3, errors for both will be handled. Bug
reported at https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1638702

Change-Id: I5e33f9b606b77d7fbaa3bfe99f6725f2b730fa9a
Closes-bug: #1638702
Signed-off-by: Sam Leonard <sam@linbit.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/32/395132/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _python2_long(self, x): try: if six.PY3 > (3,): return int(x) else: return long(x) except OverflowError: msg = _LE('Volume Size is too large: %s' % str(x)) LOG.exception(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) except TypeError: msg = _LE('Volume Size must be a number: %s' % str(x)) LOG.exception(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) except ValueError: msg = _LE('Volume Size is invalid: %s' % str(x)) LOG.exception(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendAPIException(data=msg) try: return self._python2_long(size * units.Gi / units.Ki) except OverflowError: msg = _LE('Volume Size in KiB is too large: %s' % str(size)) LOG.exception(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendDriver(data=msg) try: return self._python2_long(size * units.Ki / units.Gi) except OverflowError: msg = _LE('Volume Size in GiB is too large: %s' % str(size))) LOG.exception(msg) raise exception.VolumeBackendDriver(data=msg)
deleted_lines: import sys def _my_long(self, x): if sys.version_info > (3,): return int(x) else: return long(x) return self._my_long(size * units.Gi / units.Ki) return self._my_long(size * units.Ki / units.Gi)

commit_message:
Stop using mox in cinder/tests/uniit/api

Replaced stubs.Set() with mock_object() in some test classes in
cinder/tests/unit

subject: Add warning message for None volume type set
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-29 02:12:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/c43b7e122f47658128a2deadc2e43be1d4664273', 'message': "Add warning message for None volume type set

In the case that the default_volume_type that is configured
does not exist a volume that is created with no volume_type
specified will get a 'None' volume_type set.  This is left-
over functionality from before we had a default_volume_type.

If no volume type can be set a volume is given the 'None'
type and the scheduler is left to figure out where the volume
can be created.  When this happens an exception is thrown to
the cinder-api.log file and the volume is still created.

To make it clearer that this is intentional behavior, this
patch adds a warning message indicating that a volume_type
couldn't be determined by any other means and that the 'None'
type was intentionally used by default.

Change-Id: I3af5633446a3a7ba850f45d3935a2a24d731b443

commit_message:
Add warning message for None volume type set

In the case that the default_volume_type that is configured
does not exist a volume that is created with no volume_type
specified will get a 'None' volume_type set.  This is left-
over functionality from before we had a default_volume_type.

If no volume type can be set a volume is given the 'None'
type and the scheduler is left to figure out where the volume
can be created.  When this happens an exception is thrown to
the cinder-api.log file and the volume is still created.

To make it clearer that this is intentional behavior, this
patch adds a warning message indicating that a volume_type
couldn't be determined by any other means and that the 'None'
type was intentionally used by default.

Change-Id: I3af5633446a3a7ba850f45d3935a2a24d731b443

commit_message:
DRBD: Use the ClientHelper class to reduce amount of code

The DRBD Manage' DrbdManageClientHelp class is designed to accumulate
code that is common across various DRBD Manage clients; using this
shared code eases maintenance.

Change-Id: Ie33082d4c99b33d1af8bfcdc5842e11d85988064

commit_message:
DRBD: Avoid an extra resize later on

Since 0.97 DRBD Manage accepts the new size on
restore_snapshot() already; this reduces the number
of API calls and other DRBD operations.

Change-Id: I69803bcc29fa8f0bfa14d72ce917b5c5c29552b0

Replace 'self' by 'cls' in classmethod

We should use 'cls' instead of 'self' in classmethod. This patch
will fix it.

commit_message:
Enable deletion of inactive logical volumes

Currently if an LV is inactive and managed by Cinder, Cinder
is unable to clear the volume and delete it because to do so
it looks for its device file path which only exists for active
volumes/snapshots. This patch enables deletion of these volumes
by first checking if the volume is inactive, if it finds that it
is it will activate it before attempting deletion.

Change-Id: I04c70a11609b774a6ea2b130d195b1aefb956069
Closes-Bug: #1602078

commit_message:
Convert InvalidVolumeMetadataSize to webob.exc.*

To be consistent with update(), the create() method
of volume should be converted InvalidVolumeMetadataSize
exception to webob.exc.HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge as well.

Volume creation will now return 413 instead of 400
for invalid metadata sizes.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I65cd35f96aa5a3cd4d0bbd72298c98599daad124

subject: Make divisible py3 compatible in hpe driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-31 10:51:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_lefthand_iscsi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_common.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/3d89436aff24a0d418931539d04ce3c29b9576db', 'message': "Make divisible py3 compatible in hpe driver

the code:
import platform
print('Python', platform.python_version())
print('3 / 2 =', 3 / 2)
print('3 // 2 =', 3 // 2)
print('3 / 2.0 =', 3 / 2.0)
print('3 // 2.0 =', 3 // 2.0)

in py2
('Python', '2.7.10')
('3 / 2 =', 1)
('3 // 2 =', 1)
('3 / 2.0 =', 1.5)
('3 // 2.0 =', 1.0)

in py3 Python 3.4.3+
3 / 2 = 1.5
3 // 2 = 1
3 / 2.0 = 1.5
3 // 2.0 = 1.0
So it need to modify the code to adapt to this difference.

Change-Id: I69aec948879eddc5f4f4f47f05c3905b3521e6d8
Closes-Bug: #1596145
"}]
commit_message:
Make divisible py3 compatible in hpe driver

the code:
import platform
print('Python', platform.python_version())
print('3 / 2 =', 3 / 2)
print('3 // 2 =', 3 // 2)
print('3 / 2.0 =', 3 / 2.0)
print('3 // 2.0 =', 3 // 2.0)

in py2
('Python', '2.7.10')
('3 / 2 =', 1)
('3 // 2 =', 1)
('3 / 2.0 =', 1.5)
('3 // 2.0 =', 1.0)

in py3 Python 3.4.3+
3 / 2 = 1.5
3 // 2 = 1
3 / 2.0 = 1.5
3 // 2.0 = 1.0
So it need to modify the code to adapt to this difference.

Change-Id: I69aec948879eddc5f4f4f47f05c3905b3521e6d8
Closes-Bug: #1596145

commit_message:
add function call chain

function call chain is not explicit when create volume failed from
image. It's necessary to rasie what exactlly happened, for better
use of troubleshooting.

Change-Id: I36cb3aa6356f761c3c334cc5305766662b5c6ef0
Closes-Bug: #1582473

commit_message:
NetApp E-Series: Add volume tagging for back-end

The E-Series back-end does not allow volume names to be longer
than 30 characters. This means that volume UUIDs have to be shortened
in order to use them on the back-end. However, this does make it
difficult for admins to identify the volumes in the E-Series management
software.

In order to resolve this issue in the future, new volumes will be defined
with a metadata tag that allows the admin to search by the Cinder volume
name in the UI.

Implements: blueprint netapp-eseries-volume-tagging

Change-Id: Ia64c1aa2427318ee36d8307234049a2ddee3354b

commit_message:
Dedup code for test_cgsnapshots.py

Many test cases in test_cgsnapshots.py share the same code to
create request body and get response.

This patch refactors those duplicated code.

Change-Id: I8e2667fdb7ac10c890d41e46b04dc46066e5b741

Make examples consistent with actul API

The API version examples of block storage is not consistent
with actual API anymore. This patch tries to fix it.

subject: Resize ploop disk from glance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-29 14:55:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/d63f281fa37e374dd4b0a4a76b4c394ce78e4b7d', 'message': "Resize ploop disk from glance

Virtuozzo doesn't allow to resize filesystem inside container.
So we can't use cloud init and we should resize filesystem after
we copy image from glance to LVM. If we don't do this, then
we see the available disk space equal to the space of the original
image from glance.
Ploop disks always have only one partition and GPT table.
So we resize first partition to the end of disk.

Change-Id: Ic50f4a50a7f0b8187baf53b5bfc74c9981a69a81

"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-05 07:28:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/1ea318fea9014ced3e03d12bcfe9237f1ff12eee', 'message': "Resize ploop disk from glance

Scenario:
- Create volume which is based on image from glance

In this case cinder creates new volume and then
copies downloaded image to this volume.
Usually size of the volume is bigger than size of the image.
So we need to resize partition and filesystem in this volume.
We can't resize block device from virtuozzo container
(via cloud-init), because write access to block device
is prohibited from container(for security reason).
So the solution is to resize partition and filesystem
when we copy image to volume. If we don't do this,
then we see the available disk space equal to the space
of the original image from glance. We call 'ploop resize'
with zero size, it means resize partition to the end of disk.

Change-Id: Ic50f4a50a7f0b8187baf53b5bfc74c9981a69a81

commit_message:
Resize ploop disk from glance

Scenario:
- Create volume which is based on image from glance

In this case cinder creates new volume and then
copies downloaded image to this volume.
Usually size of the volume is bigger than size of the image.
So we need to resize partition and filesystem in this volume.
We can't resize block device from virtuozzo container
(via cloud-init), because write access to block device
is prohibited from container(for security reason).
So the solution is to resize partition and filesystem
when we copy image to volume. If we don't do this,
then we see the available disk space equal to the space
of the original image from glance. We call 'ploop resize'
with zero size, it means resize partition to the end of disk.

Change-Id: Ic50f4a50a7f0b8187baf53b5bfc74c9981a69a81
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/67/362167/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _ploop_align_vol(self, volume_path): try: self._execute('ploop', 'resize', '-s', '0', volume_path, run_as_root=True) except processutils.ProcessExecutionError as exc: raise exception.VolumePloopAlignException(vol_path=volume_path, reason=exc.stderr) finally: self._unmap_partitions(volume_path) image_meta = image_service.show(context, image_id) if image_meta['disk_format'] == 'ploop': self._ploop_align_vol(self.local_path(volume))

subject: DRBD: Avoid duplicated volumes from the error path
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 11:31:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/2cfd0f90abd180b05f569550d29394d5eb459f3d', 'message': "DRBD: Avoid duplicated volumes from the error path

If the DRBD Manage daemon and/or DBus is blocked at the wrong time,
we might get a DBus timeout in the create_volume() call - and then
call_or_reconnect() would retry it immediately, effectively making
two volumes in the resource.

Don't retry this call, but have the Cinder stack redo the whole
operation - including the check for an already existing volume.

Change-Id: I4355e9d23a26ade6db5179069bb78e5659f9f8b0
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-27 14:18:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/55ea110249c94b24347524aaac674f799d9cc654', 'message': "DRBD: Avoid duplicated volumes from the error path

If the DRBD Manage daemon and/or DBus is blocked at the wrong time,
we might get a DBus timeout in the create_volume() call - and then
call_or_reconnect() would retry it immediately, effectively making
two volumes in the resource.

commit_message:
DRBD: Avoid duplicated volumes from the error path

If the DRBD Manage daemon and/or DBus is blocked at the wrong time,
we might get a DBus timeout in the create_volume() call - and then
call_or_reconnect() would retry it immediately, effectively making
two volumes in the resource.

Don't retry this call, but have the Cinder stack redo the whole
operation - including the check for an already existing volume.

Change-Id: I4355e9d23a26ade6db5179069bb78e5659f9f8b0
Closes-Bug: #1613690
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/74/347274/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This *must* not be call_or_reconnect(). In case we get a dbus # timeout we'd immediately try again, and so the resource would # have *two* volumes with the same cinder-ID. # If that call fails, have the entire chain fail, so that Cinder # restarts it and we run the check for an existing volume again. res = self.odm.create_volume(d_res_name,

commit_message:
Move metadata checking to api/snapshot

To achieve better performance, the metadata checking
should be done as early as possible. So it's better
to move the checking logic from volume/api to
api/snapshots.

Change-Id: I65a850bb5b17a4da7ce45a339dd87629b53a7f45

commit_message:
Use json output for qemu-img info

QemuImgInfo is realized by parsing the output string of 'qemu-img info
**.img' line by line, it's complicated and improvment can be done. The
command 'qemu-img info **.img --output json' will produce json style
output and arguments can be parsed easily by calling json.loads. This
refactor will get rid of the frustrating regular expression and string
functions.

Closes-Bug:#1590252
Depends-On:Iefa139dc4bcea864cb86371d8a24df0e4695169c
Change-Id: I048128308ee33994774e61fe66e9b4bc87a9f6d0

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-24 10:08:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/24a2fe9cd9ec0f00f4c745099192de927f7c9d9d', 'message': 'Manage: Restrict volume creation for unsupported host format

Volume manage API expects hostname in the form "host@backend#pool".
If hostname is passed without backend information like "host" then
manage api creates a new volume which goes in the error state. When
user tries to delete this newly created volume then it remains in
"deleting" state forever.

service_get() db api has a provision to get the service from the host
for appropriate backend by passing "backend_match_level" parameter.
To use this, modified get_by_args() method of service object to accept
"backend_match_level" which internally calls service_get() db api and
check that hostname given is as per format "host@backend#pool" else
raises HTTPBadRequests and will not create new volume.

Closes-Bug: #1634792

commit_message:
Manage: Restrict volume creation for unsupported host format

Volume manage API expects hostname in the form "host@backend#pool".
If hostname is passed without backend information like "host" then
manage api creates a new volume which goes in the error state. When
user tries to delete this newly created volume then it remains in
"deleting" state forever.

service_get() db api has a provision to get the service from the host
for appropriate backend by passing "backend_match_level" parameter.
To use this, modified get_by_args() method of service object to accept
"backend_match_level" which internally calls service_get() db api and
check that hostname given is as per format "host@backend#pool" else
raises HTTPBadRequests and will not create new volume.

Closes-Bug: #1634792
Change-Id: I5a9372ed21f7b27f23fc8c57d1179dd97c66b930
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/46/401946/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-24 05:59:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/380eaec1de1257d0c0dec904181c02b5a9c5328b', 'message': 'Fix for resource field length in database for quota tables

Problem description:
Currently whenever the combination of (volume_type,property) is longer
255 characters for resource column in quota tables, the cinder
quota-update command errors. This change uses volume_type_id as suffix
for gigabytes,volumes & snapshots resources instead of volume_type_name.

The volume_type_id uses 36 characters at maximum as it uses UUID.

commit_message:
Fix for resource field length in database for quota tables

Problem description:
Currently whenever the combination of (volume_type,property) is longer
255 characters for resource column in quota tables, the cinder
quota-update command errors. This change uses volume_type_id as suffix
for gigabytes,volumes & snapshots resources instead of volume_type_name.

The volume_type_id uses 36 characters at maximum as it uses UUID.
This approach is preferred over extending the length of resource_type column
as it does not need any db downtime while upgrading.

Change-Id: Ic09336aca718107297caf2cb815e5da07dd918b6
Closes-bug: #1608849
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/66/390166/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Scality volume driver should use DLM
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-27 20:48:03.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/scality.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/878c2f781dc10fb20cc8be62230f84aabf0a5093', 'message': 'Scality volume driver should use DLM

In attempt to make Cinder HA A/A ready ScalityDriver should start
using RemoteFSSnapDriverDistributed instead of RemoteFSSnapDriver,
this will change locked snapshot operations to use distributed
lock manager. Moreover remotefs.locked_volume_id_operation
decorator should be switched to coordination.synchronized.

Partially implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Closes-bug: 1607059

Change-Id: I258e5bcf8cff786089181420a95cad98a811a20c
'}]
commit_message:
Scality volume driver should use DLM

In attempt to make Cinder HA A/A ready ScalityDriver should start
using RemoteFSSnapDriverDistributed instead of RemoteFSSnapDriver,
this will change locked snapshot operations to use distributed
lock manager. Moreover remotefs.locked_volume_id_operation
decorator should be switched to coordination.synchronized.

Partially implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Closes-bug: 1607059

Change-Id: I258e5bcf8cff786089181420a95cad98a811a20c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/34/348034/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from cinder import coordinationclass ScalityDriver(remotefs_drv.RemoteFSSnapDriverDistributed): @coordination.synchronized('{self.driver_prefix}-{volume.id}') @coordination.synchronized('{self.driver_prefix}-{volume.id}')

commit_message:
Add a parameter for convert_image method

To some network storage system like 'ceph rbd' and 'sheepdog',
the current convert_image method can't convert a source image to
the dest if the dest image is already exists in the storage
backend. This is not conveniently in some cases.

This patch add a optional parameter 'create_new_image' for
the method to support this case.

Change-Id: I6f990c2704c0bcc43f1f1acb05f149413882c8ff
Closes-Bug: #1603076
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/73/342173/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Test for dest image is already exist. output = image_utils.convert_image(source, dest, out_format, create_new_image=False) self.assertIsNone(output) mock_exec.assert_called_once_with('qemu-img', 'convert', '-n', '-O', out_format, source, dest, run_as_root=True) # Test for dest image is already exist. output = image_utils.convert_image(source, dest, out_format, create_new_image=False) self.assertIsNone(output) mock_exec.assert_called_once_with('qemu-img', 'convert', '-n', '-O', out_format, source, dest, run_as_root=True) # Test for dest image is already exist. output = image_utils.convert_image(source, dest, out_format, create_new_image=False) self.assertIsNone(output) mock_exec.assert_called_once_with('qemu-img', 'convert', '-n', '-O', out_format, source, dest, run_as_root=True)

subject: Allow archiving deleted rows to shadow tables, for performance
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-10-27 15:56:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/3332ae3480c94f1b154241388763789e6e167a80', 'message': 'WIP! Allow archiving deleted rows to shadow tables, for performance.

WIP status: ported code from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/18493/34,
working on spec

Add versions of all tables with "shadow_" prepended to their names.
These shadow tables do not have indexes.
Adds API function archive_deleted_rows, which moves some deleted
rows from production tables to the corresponding shadow tables.
(It only does a few rows, to avoid blocking the process or hitting
the database too hard.  So it needs to be called regularly.)

Implements bp db-archiving

Change-Id: Ib536830e2e69b93d1514311561b6a3aeccdeb0ea

commit_message:
Allow archiving deleted rows to shadow tables, for performance

Add versions of all tables with "shadow_" prepended to their names.
These shadow tables do not have indexes.
Adds API function archive_deleted_rows, which moves some deleted
rows from production tables to the corresponding shadow tables.
(It only does a few rows, to avoid blocking the process or hitting
the database too hard. So it needs to be called regularly.)

Code is based on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/18493/34
Spec review-request: https://review.openstack.org/135916

Implements bp db-archiving
DocImpact

Co-Authored-By: Abhishek Kekane <abhishek.kekane@nttdata.com>
Change-Id: Ib536830e2e69b93d1514311561b6a3aeccdeb0ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/82/131182/30 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from sqlalchemy import Booleanfrom sqlalchemy import Integer from sqlalchemy import MetaData from sqlalchemy.exc import NoSuchTableErrorfrom sqlalchemy.schema import Tablefrom sqlalchemy.sql.expression import selectfrom sqlalchemy import String ################# def _get_default_deleted_value(table): # TODO(e0ne): It would be better to introspect the actual default value # from the column, but I don't see a way to do that in the low-level APIs # of SQLAlchemy 0.7. 0.8 has better introspection APIs, which we should # use when Nova is ready to require 0.8. deleted_column_type = table.c.deleted.type if isinstance(deleted_column_type, Integer): return 0 elif isinstance(deleted_column_type, Boolean): return False elif isinstance(deleted_column_type, String): return "" else: return None @require_admin_context def archive_deleted_rows_for_table(context, tablename, max_rows=None): """Move up to max_rows rows from one tables to the corresponding shadow table. :returns: number of rows archive """ # The context argument is only used for the decorator. if max_rows is None: max_rows = 5000 engine = get_engine() conn = engine.connect() metadata = MetaData() metadata.bind = engine table = Table(tablename, metadata, autoload=True) default_deleted_value = _get_default_deleted_value(table) shadow_tablename = "shadow_" + tablename rows_archived = 0 try: shadow_table = Table(shadow_tablename, metadata, autoload=True) except NoSuchTableError: # No corresponding shadow table; skip it. return rows_archived # Group the insert and delete in a transaction. with conn.begin(): # TODO(dripton): It would be more efficient to insert(select) and then # delete(same select) without ever returning the selected rows back to # Python. sqlalchemy does not support that directly, but we have # nova.db.sqlalchemy.utils.InsertFromSelect for the insert side. We # need a corresponding function for the delete side. try: column = table.c.id column_name = "id" except AttributeError: # We have one table (dns_domains) where the key is called # "domain" rather than "id" column = table.c.domain column_name = "domain" query = select([table], table.c.deleted != default_deleted_value).\ order_by(column).limit(max_rows) rows = conn.execute(query).fetchall() if rows: insert_statement = shadow_table.insert() conn.execute(insert_statement, rows) keys = [getattr(row, column_name) for row in rows] delete_statement = table.delete(column.in_(keys)) result = conn.execute(delete_statement) rows_archived = result.rowcount return rows_archived @require_admin_context def archive_deleted_rows(context, max_rows=None): """Move up to max_rows rows from production tables to the corresponding shadow tables. :returns: Number of rows archived. """ # The context argument is only used for the decorator. if max_rows is None: max_rows = 5000 tablenames = [] for model_class in models.__dict__.itervalues(): if hasattr(model_class, "__tablename__"): tablenames.append(model_class.__tablename__) rows_archived = 0 for tablename in tablenames: rows_archived += archive_deleted_rows_for_table(context, tablename, max_rows=max_rows - rows_archived) if rows_archived >= max_rows: break return rows_archived

subject: set_metadata throws AttributeError: id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-20 16:50:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/e3c70d1ae211a0e288d4d65c85329f2a3991b93f', 'message': 'set_metadata throws AttributeError: id

When cinderclient set metadata it makes a post request to cinder
to the url "volume/<uuid>/metadata". When using python-cinderclient,
we get AttributeError running volume.set_metadata().

Due to the fact that the documentation does not specify that a volume
should return from the API call, the return statement is remove.

Change-Id: Ic070ea76509e418b54935aa16cd3faf54973a314
Closes-Bug: #1315175
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-21 14:13:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/8604cfed227de1f796aaf19ee13d651d51aee943', 'message': 'set_metadata throws AttributeError: id

When cinderclient set metadata it makes a post request to cinder
to the url "volume/<uuid>/metadata". When using python-cinderclient,
we get AttributeError running volume.set_metadata().

Due to the fact that the documentation does not specify that a volume
should return from the API call, the return statement is remove.

Change-Id: Ic070ea76509e418b54935aa16cd3faf54973a314
Closes-Bug: #1315175
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-27 13:04:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/75f61f3c5d163694598e86d4e882ee39669f7848', 'message': 'set_metadata throws AttributeError: id

When cinderclient set metadata it makes a post request to cinder
to the url "volume/<uuid>/metadata", cinder returns the updated
metadata. When using python-cinderclient, we get AttributeError
running volume.set_metadata(). We add class VolumeMetadata to
fix it. Now set_metadata returns VolumeMetadata resource.

Change-Id: Ic070ea76509e418b54935aa16cd3faf54973a314
Closes-Bug: #1315175

commit_message:
set_metadata throws AttributeError: id

When cinderclient sets metadata it makes a post request to cinder
to the url "volume/<uuid>/metadata", cinder returns the updated
metadata. When using python-cinderclient, we get AttributeError
running volume.set_metadata(). We add class VolumeMetadata to fix
it. Now set_metadata returns VolumeMetadata resource.

Co-Authoder By: Ivan Kolodyazhny<e0ne@e0ne.info>
Change-Id: Ic070ea76509e418b54935aa16cd3faf54973a314
Closes-Bug: #1315175
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/75/308475/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._create("/volumes/%s/metadata" % base.getid(volume), body, "metadata")

commit_message:
Microversion update to get-pools command

Currently get-pools returns two fields total_capacity_gb
& free_capacity_gb with values 'infinite' or 'unknown'.
After https://review.openstack.org/#/c/374971/, it will
start using 'inf' & 'NaN' instead.

This patch makes sure we update the microversion for the
above change.

Depends-On: I3681415654c25f8a6c4dec838a62831f7ae35b13

Change-Id: Ie27b09841929e446e82bbde5b5a094302d52b0d4

commit_message:
Fix incorrent behaviour of encrypted-volume-type

For API users, when a volume_type doesn't have any encryption-type,
VolumeEncryptionTypeManager's get() function returns a class
VolumeEncryptionType which contains useless info in it.

This behavior is illogic and inconsistent with other API, it makes
user thought that a useful VolumeEncryptionType is returned.
We should just return request_ids when there is no encryption-type.

Change-Id: I503d2b19c10e1db413e6b48efa0be29441c9b847
closes-bug: 1562024
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/34/297934/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use token instead of password when construct novaclient auth

When construct auth, if using username and password parameters,
pass user_id and auth_token would cause failure. Using Token
instead Password may be a better choice.

Pass auth_url instead of url which is used to connect with nova
for identity.

Closes-Bug: #1651983
Change-Id: Ic547d6f504951e8a9753d5230e41314f03a073bf

commit_message:
Sheepdog Thin Provisioning stats

Allow the sheepdog driver to work with max_over_subscription_ratio.

Change-Id: Id7b8046e9c60edb303744aaf771a718a1ee0e321
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/41/411841/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pattern_str = r'[\w\s%]*Total\s(\d+)\s(\d+)\s\d+\s\S+\s(\d+)*' self.stats_pattern = re.compile(pattern_str) stats['provisioned_capacity_gb'] = 0 stats['thin_provisioning_support'] = True stats['max_over_subscription_ratio'] = self.configuration.safe_get( 'max_over_subscription_ratio') virtual_size = float(m.group(3)) stats['provisioned_capacity_gb'] = virtual_size / units.Gi

commit_message:
Add Open-E driver for JovianDSS storage with iSCSI support

This driver implements features:

 - Create / Delete volume
 - Extend volume
 - Attach / Detach volume
 - Create / Delete snapshot
 - Copy Image to Volume
 - Copy Volume to Image
 - Clone volume
 - Create volume from snapshot

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint open-e-joviandss-driver
Change-Id: Ibdd1214a7099e1e53636780272c187927002ea1e

commit_message:
Remove deprecated CONF.use_default_quota_class

We no longer use the global default_quota_class, so remove
the logic and deprecation warning.

Closes-Bug: #1609937
backport-potential: newton
Change-Id: Ida2deb2a694098cdce183759c4d0f6d0e4a350f3

subject: Use "wait_for_volume_resource_status" function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-26 16:08:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/939b84c9204bc2ed423a2b0df249178faad62f91', 'message': 'Use "wait_for_volume_resource_status" function

The function "wait_for_volume_resource_status" is a future function
in 'tempest' project. This function waits for a volume resource to reach
a given status. The function is a common function for volume, snapshot
and backup resources.
Until the following patch [1] won't be merged this patch always fails.
Currently, the patch [1] can not merge due to failure in jenkins related
to test in 'cinder' project, cinder.tests.tempest.api.volume.
test_volume_unicode.CinderUnicodeTest. In conclusion, this patch and [1]
are interdependent.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/394588/

Change-Id: I4780bf2a2bd8520fa720a06a7624db59615880fe
Depends-On: 391a956992d4b9ab9811b648855f8300c4c902ed

Until the following patch [1] won't be merged this patch always fails.
Currently, the patch [1] can not merge due to failure in jenkins related

commit_message:
Use "wait_for_volume_resource_status" function

The function "wait_for_volume_resource_status" is a future function
in 'tempest' project. This function waits for a volume resource to reach
a given status. The function is a common function for volume, snapshot
and backup resources.
Until the following patch [1] won't be merged this patch always fails.
Currently, the patch [1] can not merge due to failure in jenkins related
to test in 'cinder' project, cinder.tests.tempest.api.volume.
test_volume_unicode.CinderUnicodeTest. In conclusion, this patch and [1]
are interdependent.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/394588/

Change-Id: I4780bf2a2bd8520fa720a06a7624db59615880fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/15/415015/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: CoprHD: Handle create volume from CG snap error
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-06 14:38:37.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/coprhd/common.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/bb8186fdbba3875e3f2307438e77edc8ce2f8603', 'message': 'CoprHD: Handle create volume from CG snap error

Currently, in created_cloned_volume() (if invoked from
create_volume_from_snapshot function), when we create a volume
from a snapshot, we need to check if that snapshot is
part of a Consistency group, our current implementation
only checks if a Volume is part of a consistency group and
not snapshot.

For a VMAX Snapshot, we need not check if the size of
snapshot is greater than the size of the source volume because
for Snapshot we cannot specify a size, so fixed this as well.
Also used the correct exception type to handle meta-data
which differs for Snapshot and Volume.

Change-Id: Iefcaef9074e607b9396a9f8aae7854f4d8834c73
Closes-Bug: #1654562
'}]
commit_message:
CoprHD: Handle create volume from CG snap error

Currently, in created_cloned_volume() (if invoked from
create_volume_from_snapshot function), when we create a volume
from a snapshot, we need to check if that snapshot is
part of a Consistency group, our current implementation
only checks if a Volume is part of a consistency group and
not snapshot.

For a VMAX Snapshot, we need not check if the size of
snapshot is greater than the size of the source volume because
for Snapshot we cannot specify a size, so fixed this as well.
Also used the correct exception type to handle meta-data
which differs for Snapshot and Volume.

Change-Id: Iefcaef9074e607b9396a9f8aae7854f4d8834c73
Closes-Bug: #1654562
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/99/417399/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create_cloned_volume( self, vol, src_vref, truncate_name=False, isVMAXSnapshot=False): part_of_cg = False part_of_cg = True except AttributeError as e: try: if src_vref['cgsnapshot_id']: part_of_cg = True except AttributeError as e: pass if part_of_cg: raise coprhd_utils.CoprHdError( coprhd_utils.CoprHdError.SOS_FAILURE_ERR, _("Clone can't be taken individually on a volume" " that is part of a Consistency Group")) except AttributeError: if isVMAXSnapshot: return self.create_cloned_volume( volume, snapshot, truncate_name) self.create_cloned_volume( snapshot, volume, truncate_name, True)
deleted_lines: def create_cloned_volume(self, vol, src_vref, truncate_name=False): raise coprhd_utils.CoprHdError( coprhd_utils.CoprHdError.SOS_FAILURE_ERR, _("Clone can't be taken individually on a volume" " that is part of a Consistency Group")) except KeyError as e: pass except KeyError: self.create_cloned_volume(volume, snapshot, truncate_name) self.create_cloned_volume(snapshot, volume, truncate_name)

commit_message:
Clean up `cinder show` when volume is attached

As addressed in bug #1494941 - when `cinder show` is used
on an attached volume, the 'attachments' field
in the table shown is huge and greatly distorts the table.

This patch cleans up the dictionary value of any
attachments, so that no redundant or unecessary values
are show. It also makes the attachments value
multi line in the table, so that there is enough room
for all needed fields.

Change-Id: Ieee767cf638e9fac9fff4621638430b6cd3ad4e6
Closes-bug: #1494941

commit_message:
Fix a reset-state bug

As bug below says, we need some modify for this bug.
If we add these modification, that's problem will be
fixed. The results is as following:

cinder list
+--------+------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Status | Migration Status |             Attached to              |
+--------+------------------+--------------------------------------+
| in-use |      error       | 25e82035-9238-4413-8791-6add0455ab3d |
+--------+------------------+--------------------------------------+
cinder reset-state --reset-migration-status
                   91cc6b0b-2bc8-437c-bca4-b654de620d47
cinder list
+--------+------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Status | Migration Status |             Attached to              |
+--------+------------------+--------------------------------------+
| in-use |        -         | 25e82035-9238-4413-8791-6add0455ab3d |
+--------+------------------+--------------------------------------+

But there has another question, what if migration_status
is success and volume detach failed?
At this time, volume status is error and 'if' condition
was true, so volume's new status is aways equals to his
original status, reset-state command was failed. I have not
any ideals to solve problem like this. Want other reviewers
give me some opinions.

Change-Id: I8a3a4906a0e637ba99f91b4059f59cb759e56275
Closes-Bug:#1657097

commit_message:
WIP multipath: Add retry flag to flush commands

The -R flag has been recently introduced into the multipath command [1].

This change is WIP while we wait for it to land in the distros.

TODO
  - Add a configurable or reuse an exising retry counter?
  - multipath commandline version check?

[1] http://git.opensvc.com/gitweb.cgi?p=multipath-tools/.git;a=commit;h=4a2b3e75719f90e356408401d3c43210a0b2e111

Change-Id: I8c22dec1d5002ade684bc836f935ea9fc4151fea

commit_message:
Fix the bug that c-api server error when reset the status

This patch closes a bug the c-api server response a code 500 when we
try to set volume status as a integer.

Closes-Bug: #1622941
Change-Id: I2c091b60e369b30ad038dae53a646f61c6edd91a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/77/369277/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_reset_attach_integer_status(self): volume = db.volume_create(self.ctx, {'attach_status': 'detached'}) resp = self._issue_volume_reset(self.ctx, volume, {'attach_status': 1}) self.assertEqual(400, resp.status_int) volume = db.volume_get(self.ctx, volume['id']) self.assertEqual('detached', volume['attach_status']) def test_reset_migration_integer_status(self): volume = db.volume_create(self.ctx, {'migration_status': None}) resp = self._issue_volume_reset(self.ctx, volume, {'migration_status': 1}) self.assertEqual(400, resp.status_int) volume = db.volume_get(self.ctx, volume['id']) self.assertIsNone(volume['migration_status']) def test_reset_integer_status(self): volume = db.volume_create(self.ctx, {'status': 'available'}) resp = self._issue_volume_reset(self.ctx, volume, {'status': 1}) self.assertEqual(400, resp.status_int) volume = db.volume_get(self.ctx, volume['id']) self.assertEqual('available', volume['status'])

commit_message:
DNM: Poke at broken unit tests

Do not merge.

This serves as a way to see what unit tests break
if the PYTHONHASHSEED value is not fixed to 0.  3
was chosen because it breaks over a dozen unit tests.

After the unit tests are fixed here, we can make
this random again.

Depends-On: I0bba326b88ba97f17ec1824c4d6ea78110ff5954
Depends-On: Id8e805293160af8ce0801b9fe07cc55ae811a206
Depends-On: Ice7c07a42573af549bc50528a139c711cf130c4c
Change-Id: I409c26916bda66c0806862dcd40ca2c7421f060d

commit_message:
Volume delete parameters

Support combination of both "--cascade" and "--force"
for volume delete operations.

Blueprint volume-delete-parameters

Depends-On: Ic47cfcf1cc7d172d7f9d5b093233035f797982f5
Change-Id: Ib055de4a773df4bfab2c21ed5d3974dccb70e359
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/04/337704/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_delete_with_force(self): self.run_command('delete 1234 --force') self.assert_called('DELETE', '/volumes/1234?force=True') def test_delete_with_cascade_and_force(self): self.run_command('delete 1234 --cascade --force') self.assert_called('DELETE', '/volumes/1234?cascade=True&force=True')

During the stats update loop, we iterate through the existing volumes to
gather statistics.  This patch allows our iteration to tolerate a volume

Closes-Bug: #1645851

commit_message:
RBD: tolerate volume deletion race in update stats

During the stats update loop, we iterate through the existing volumes to
gather statistics.  This patch allows our iteration to tolerate a volume
being deleted mid-loop.

Change-Id: Id61eb60946413285801857c5de39a5e46a18ffcf
Closes-Bug: #1645851
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/21/404821/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: with RBDVolumeProxy(self, t, read_only=True) as v: v.diff_iterate(0, v.size(), None, self._iterate_cb) except self.rbd.ImageNotFound: # We may have lost a race with volume deletion, and # that's just fine. continue
deleted_lines: with RBDVolumeProxy(self, t, read_only=True) as v: v.diff_iterate(0, v.size(), None, self._iterate_cb)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 18:54:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/10572d761f94869c08fad8a63b2a522c7520cca9', 'message': '[PoC][Don't review] Testing delay

This is just some code to facilitate manual testing of the HA A/A
functionality.

It just introduces a 30 seconds delay to create volume, create snapshot,
delete volume, and delete snapshot.

For create volume it will introduce the delay before the creation, but
in the case of downloading from an image it will introduce the delay
right after updating the status of the volume to "downloading".
